thoughts.text: I want to save the information I've gathered on legal research resources to a text file for future reference, so I will use the 'write_to_file' command to create a new file and write my notes to it.
thoughts.reasoning: As an LLM student, it is important for me to keep track of useful resources and information that I come across. By saving my notes to a text file, I can easily refer back to them in the future.
thoughts.plan:
- Use the 'write_to_file' command to create a new file called 'legal_research_resources.txt'.
- Write my notes on legal research resources to the file, including links to any useful websites or resources that I found.
thoughts.criticism: I need to make sure to organize my notes in a clear and concise manner, so that I can easily find the information I need in the future.
thoughts.speak: I want to save the information I've gathered on legal research resources to a text file for future reference, so I will use the 'write_to_file' command to create a new file and write my notes to it.

args.text:
Notes on Legal Research Resources:

- Harvard Law School Library guide on free legal research: https://guides.library.harvard.edu/law/free
- Texas State Law Library guide on legal research for beginners: https://guides.sll.texas.gov/legal-research-for-beginners
- George Mason University Law Library list of free legal research resources: https://www.law.gmu.edu/library/freelegalresearch
- Bloomberg Law's Complete Legal Research Resource: https://pro.bloomberglaw.com/the-complete-legal-research-resource/
- Clio's list of best free legal research tools: https://www.clio.com/blog/best-free-legal-research-tools/
- Alaska Court System's legal research page: https://courts.alaska.gov/library/aklegal.htm
- United Nations' legal research guide: https://research.un.org/en/legal
- LexisNexis's list of best free legal research tools: https://www.lexisnexis.com/community/insights/legal/b/thought-leadership/posts/best-free-legal-research-tools
